results.title: Clenbuterol and metformin ameliorate cachexia parameters, but only clenbuterol reduces tumor growth via lipid peroxidation in Walker 256 tumor-bearing rats.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Clenbuterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002976 @@@Clenbuterol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ ameliorate @<m>DISEASE_Cachexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002100 @@@cachexia@@@ parameters, but only @CHEMICAL_Clenbuterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002976 @@@clenbuterol@@@ reduces @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ growth via @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ peroxidation in @CELLLINE_CVCL:3537 @@@Walker 256 tumor@@@-bearing @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

Clenbuterol and metformin ameliorate cachexia parameters, but only clenbuterol reduces tumor growth via lipid peroxidation in Walker 256 tumor-bearing rats. Braz J Med Biol Res. 2025;58():e14060. results.title: Metformin treatment modulates the tumour-induced wasting effects in muscle protein metabolism minimising the cachexia in tumour-bearing rats
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment modulates the @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumour@@@-induced wasting effects in muscle protein metabolism minimising the @<m>DISEASE_Cachexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002100 @@@cachexia@@@ in @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumour@@@-bearing rats

citations.NLM: Oliveira AG, Gomes-Marcondes MC. Metformin treatment modulates the tumour-induced wasting effects in muscle protein metabolism minimising the cachexia in tumour-bearing rats BMC Cancer. 2016 Jul 7;16():418. PMID: 27388367

results.title: Synergistic simvastatin and metformin combination chemotherapy for osseous metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.
results.text_hl: Studies of @CELLLINE_CVCL:4787 @@@C4-2B4@@@ orthotopic NCr-nu/nu @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ further demonstrated that combination of @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (3.5-7.0 mug/g body weight @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and 175-350 mug/g body weight @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@) daily by oral gavage over a 9-week period significantly inhibited primary ventral @DISEASE_Prostatitis @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate tumor@@@ formation, @<m>DISEASE_Cachexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002100 @@@cachexia@@@, @DISEASE_Neoplasm_Metastasis @DISEASE_MESH:D009362 @@@bone metastasis@@@, and biochemical failure more effectively than 24 mug/g body weight @CHEMICAL_Docetaxel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077143 @@@docetaxel@@@ intraperitoneally injected every 3 weeks, 7.0 mug/g/day @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, or 350 mug/g/day @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment alone, with significantly less @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@ and mortality than @CHEMICAL_Docetaxel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077143 @@@docetaxel@@@, establishing combination of @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as a promising chemotherapeutic alternative for metastatic @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms_Castration_Resistant @DISEASE_MESH:D064129 @@@CRPC@@@.

citations.NLM: Babcook MA, Shukla S, Fu P, Vazquez EJ, Puchowicz MA, Molter JP, Oak CZ, MacLennan GT, Flask CA, Lindner DJ, Parker Y, Daneshgari F, Gupta S. Synergistic simvastatin and metformin combination chemotherapy for osseous metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer. Mol Cancer Ther. 2014 Oct;13(10):2288-302. PMID: 25122066
citations.BibTeX: @article{25122066, title={Synergistic simvastatin and metformin combination chemotherapy for osseous metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.}, author={Babcook MA and Shukla S and Fu P and Vazquez EJ and Puchowicz MA and Molter JP and Oak CZ and MacLennan GT and Flask CA and Lindner DJ and Parker Y and Daneshgari F and Gupta S}, journal={Mol Cancer Ther}, volume={13}, number={10}, pages={2288-302}}

results.title: Cancer cachexia and diabetes: similarities in metabolic alterations and possible treatment.
results.text_hl: Because the gradual @DISEASE_Muscular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009135 @@@muscle loss@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D@@@ may be attenuated by @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ treatment, anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ drugs might be considered in @<m>DISEASE_Cachexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002100 @@@cachexia@@@ treatment. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ emerges as a choice candidate as it acts both on reducing gluconeogenesis and improving @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ sensitivity, and has demonstrated @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumour@@@ suppressor properties in multiple @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ types.

citations.NLM: Chevalier S, Farsijani S. Cancer cachexia and diabetes: similarities in metabolic alterations and possible treatment. Appl Physiol Nutr Metab. 2014 Jun;39(6):643-53. PMID: 24869969
